Disallow initializing variables toundefined
üîßFixableSome problems reported by this rule are automatically fixable by the--fixcommand lineoption‚ùÑÔ∏èFrozenThis rule is currentlyfrozenand is not accepting feature requests.
Table of ContentsRule DetailsWhen Not To Use ItRelated RulesVersionResources
In JavaScript, a variable that is declared and not initialized to any value automatically gets the value ofundefined. For example:
varfoo;console.log(foo===undefined);// true123Copy code to clipboard
It‚Äôs therefore unnecessary to initialize a variable toundefined, such as:
varfoo=undefined;1Copy code to clipboard
It‚Äôs considered a best practice to avoid initializing variables toundefined.
